title: No COVID test kit shortage in Sri Lanka
content: Dr. Hemantha Herath, Deputy Director-General of Health, says that there is a shortage of COVID test kits due to the rapid spread of the Omicron variant in the world. Dr Herath emphasizes that the test kits that were received in the millions in the past have now come down to a lower level. However, he stated that there is no shortage of test kits in the country at the moment. Dr. Herath said that there were many people who had not been vaccinated and that everyone should be encouraged to get vaccinated anyway. Dr. Hemantha Herath further emphasized that once the country is open, the risk of recurrence can be prevented by adopting proper health practices.
